Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mia1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in Aug 2011. Good location (directly across from underground station). Rooms were adequate - what you need for a city break. Air con didn't work and as it was August it was very hot. Staff did give us a fan though. I would recommend if you are looking for basic, clean crash pad for exploring city.

Reviews.Title: “A great wee hotel for a family stay!”
Reviews.Author: trevorgreig
Reviews.Content: Wonderful little hotel, pretty basic but then you don't go to Barcelona to sit about in your room.Clean, well maintained and good maid service.Situated a stones throw away from Clot metro and mainline railway station so although you are a bit away from the centre you can be there in about 15 mins.Very helpful reception staff and an excellent breakfast.We will be using this hotel the next time we come to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good position but old hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuckyButterfly
Reviews.Content: I went to Catalonia Albeniz last September. Our room was at the first floor it was a simple room: clean and "essential"...we were near the lift so the first day, someone turned off the indication near the door and they didn't clean our room...the following day everything was ok, also because the lift was broken...luckely we were on the first floor, because it was repaired only after 2 days!!! The greatest problem was the hair-dryer: I thought it was broken, beacuse after 3 minutes using it stopped. I've got long hair so it was really a problem, I asked to change it but they told me that my hair-dryer was checked and it was correctly working, so it would be of no use changing it... The hotel need to be renewed but it has a good position: it is 5 minutes from the station and it is a very good thing...

Reviews.Title: “Didn't stay.”
Reviews.Author: foxtrotoscar46
Reviews.Content: We had this hotel booked for us by Travelbag cruises (what a nightmare they are.. But that is for another review) after a cruise on a five star ship, this hotel was very basic. We got there at about 10am and our two rooms were not available. We left our luggage with them and went into central Barcelona for a few hours. We returned mid afternoon and were allowed into the rooms. My first thoughts were that it was like a youth hostel.... We are talking BASIC.... Don't get me wrong, it was clean, but way to sparse for me. I like to feel comfortable in a hotel, and could not have done that here. We didn't unpack and I booked anothr hotel online and we were gone within 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel in a poor location for tourist”
Reviews.Author: 11trip
Reviews.Content: An old hotel in a residential part of town. It is next to two main roads that gets very noisy. Poor breakfast service. It is close to a metro station. You will need it to get to all tourist sites. Not within walking distance of anything of interest. Might be worth considering paying more for central location and better facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel,good loaction,old facilities and great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Anatoly106
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very good breakfast for a fair price of 7.5euro per person. The Hotel is located near a metro station (Clot) and from the same station there is a direct train to the Airport.The hotel is a bit old and needs a bit of renovation but has everything is needed.The staff is very nice and helped us even to print boarding pass for the plane.The baby bed was good.The room is big, and we got the 7 floor with good view,but quiet because there are 2 windows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel For a Barcelona Sightseeing Trip”
Reviews.Author: some_boy32
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 1 night on a sightseeing trip to Barcelona with my girlfriend and I would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling on a budget to Barcelona. I have rated it excellent because it does what I expected of it and does it really well. Of course there are more expensive and more lavish hotels around but if you are after a cheap hotel in a good location in the centre of Barcelona then this ticks all the boxes for me. Its modern, clean, comfortable and in a pretty decent area which is a good location in terms of being close to the metro and the city centre etc. Nearest Metro is Encants which is a couple of minutes away and one stop away from the Sagrada Familia which is one of the main tourist places to check out. One stop the other way is Clot station which is on the mainline and you can get trains to and from the airport here which I would recommend. The hotel is actually walkable from Clot station too. I booked our stay pretty much last minute through late rooms so you are always slightly apprehensive when doing it last minute but as I have said above it did exactly what we needed. Room was nice and clean, had a tv, hairdryer, air con etc. Staff were really friendly and helpful and we even got a complimentary bottle of red wine on our arrival which was a nice touch. We didnt pay for Breakfast in advance but you can simply add it to your bill if you decide to have it, think it was about 7 euros each and is a nice little buffet with the usual fruit, pastries, bread, cheese, meats, cereal, fruit juice and also some Spanish style egg, bacon and sausages - plenty to fill you up for a day of sightseeing. Really can't speak highly enough of this place even though we were just there for a night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1greenjacket
Reviews.Content: The bedroom and bath room was spotless. Towels and bed linen were clean and changed every day. the rooms were cleaned and made up every day. The staff were friendly and verey helpful. The breakfast is a must and sets youi up for the day. Its very close to the metro, just around the corner. Only bad point is that they should update the website about directions to the Hotel. You can now get a train direct from the Airport to Clot.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for location”
Reviews.Author: AntonMilcu
Reviews.Content: Good location, very close to subway/train directly from airport/costa brava. Also close to Sagrada. Nice area around, a couple of restaurants. Rooms very small, but clean, towels and bad made each day. Staff friendly. Breakfast is too expensive, do not know how the food was, but for this amount can find something else nearby. The safe cost 5 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “NOT SO GREAT”
Reviews.Author: v_liany
Reviews.Content: Its not too far from train st, so location is pretty good..and its walking distance to La Sagrada..however, the hotel is pretty old..and although bathroom was clean..i felt that the bed wasnt too clean..bit dusty..and safe deposit box is available-not Gratis...so its kinda dissapointing..and since we just stay in a better 2star hotel in Madrid.. as a 3 star hotel..i dont think it live up to its rep

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice staff, safe area”
Reviews.Author: katb99
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice very clean,breakfast was good. The only downside was that it was a little way from central area. But the street behind the hotel with shops made up for this. Nice to see a real Spanish area rather than the more tourist parts! NIce little bar on the corner with a parrot :) We made our way to glories and got the bus from there a few days. Barcelona is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Superb comfort and location for the price!”
Reviews.Author: gus24o8
Reviews.Content: We fell in love with this place right from the beginning. The staff was very kind, spoke decent English and showed a rare modesty. The room was very clean, the bathroom was spotless. The double bed looked brand new, the minibar helped a lot and the balcony was a big bonus. The noise of the street was nothing due to double glazing and thick curtains. A real three stars hotel! We also loved its location. The tube and train station(direct link with the airport) are in two minutes walk and all main attractions are only few stops away. There's lots of shops,bars and coffee shops around plus a superb flee market. Add all together and you'll think twice before paying the same price for a hostel in the very center of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Value hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Rubia22
Reviews.Content: Being familiar with the Catalonia chain of hotels from stays in Madrid, I was intrigued to see that they had a 3 star (only) property in Barcelona. (Madrid properties are 4 star and above.) It was recommended to me by my travel agent. Overall I was very satisfied by the property: the size of both the room and the bathroom were good and it was very clean, if a little tired. Shower pressure was excellent. I found all the staff on reception to be very courteous and friendly, with the exception of one of the night staff, who may actually have been a manager. The breakfast was a standard buffet breakfast in a Spanish hotel and the waiting staff were attentive. A nice feature was "help yourself" coffee at the breakfast bar. As other reviews have pointed out, the hotel is in a residential area and a bit far removed from the city centre, but the Metro is close, fast, reliable and safe. (Always use the exit C/Arago from the platform on Line 1; other exits will be a much longer walk back to the hotel.) My only minor complaint about the hotel is with the "snack bar". They do not have a full service restaurant but seem to pride themselves on their snack bar. I found that it had closed early two nights running. I only wanted a drink, nothing to eat, and was told this was absolutely impossible. I was referred to the high priced mini bar in my room. Not a satisfactory alternative. There is a PC in the lobby area where one can pay (2 euros for 10 minutes minimum) to access the internet and send/receive emails. More and more hotels are offering this welcome service. Unfortunately it was broken my last night there and precluded me from on-line check-in for my return flight, a disappointment, but not the end of the world. Re: Travel to and from the airport -- please note that the train to and from the airport (Linea C2) stops at El Clot - Arago. The journey takes just under 30 mins and the station is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. You can use one of the T10 tickets (metro, bus, train). The train to and from the airport arrives at Terminal 2. British Airways uses Terminal 1, so a short transfer by shuttle bus is necessary. I highly recommend the Hop on/Hop Off Tourist Bus. I also highly recommend a visit during the annual end of summer fesitival "Merce" or "Merced" at the end of September. There are events all day and into the night for 4 days running. There were amazing fireworks at Barceloneta every night at 10pm. Loved Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice break”
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: Spent a 3 night break with my wife at this hotel.It is a bit away from the centre but is very handy for the Metro [nearest station 300 metres away goes by the lovely name of Clot]. The best way to use the local transport which is all integrated is to buy a 10 trip ticket for approx 7 euros.We managed to pack in all the sights in the time we were there.The hotel was comfotable and the breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice.Barcelona is an excellent destination for a weekend break as witnessed by the mant stag and hen parties that go there.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: arwen204086
Reviews.Content: We were surprised by the very good price-quality ratio and would go there again: quiet and clean room, very friendly staff, metro station very close

Reviews.Title: “Sweet little Hotel, but just for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: MaxVko
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this Hotel on the weekend 19-22 March 2009, we leave the frozen Moscow and found a good weather in Bacelona. The hotel location is good - 1 minute to Metro station "Clot", where you can easy reach to airport in 32 minutes and City Center in 10 minutes. I suppose, that the not short distance to attractive objects is advantage for that, anyway you can catch the Bus Turistic at nearest point at Gaudi Sagrada Familia, that takes you 10 minute walk. The advantages of this hotel are: good location, low price, nice window view (you can see in the my photos), tasty classical brekfast. The disadvantages: room's safe was broken, bad sound proofing between rooms, high level of street noise. Be more careful and keep an eye your bags at the sightseeing points.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: MrLittlewood
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me just say, Barcelona is beautiful. We had a fantastic long weekend in the city and stayed here. Secondly, this hotel is nothing like a hostel as per the review further down!?!?! We found this hotel to be absolutely fine and perfect for a city break in Barcelona. The Catalonia Albeniz hotel itself is slightly on the out skirts of the city in a more residential area but dont let that you you off. The taxi driver who picked us up from the bus station hadn't heard of the hotel so if you experience any confusion in your taxi, just ask for Aragon as this is right next door. Alternatively, if you are catching the tube to the hotel from the bus station, walk to the Arc Triumph tube station (near the but station), get on the red line north and then get off at "Clot". The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the "Clot" red-line tube station. (From the hotel, turn left outside the front doors, walk to the traffic lights then cross over the road). The tube in Barcelona is definitely the easiest, cheapest and quickest way of getting round the city. Just hop on the red line, go south and get off at Universitat and you are near the Gothic Quarter, Ramblas and the tourist part of the city. It takes about 10-15 minutes on the tube. Tickets are purchased from the machines in the tube station and are cheap. There were young, middle and older aged people on the tube all day and night. We never felt at risk or unsafe. Back to the hotel. The rooms are perfectly adequate and spacious. Our room was on the third floor and was lovely and clean as was the bathroom. The room was cleaned daily. No coffee/tea making facilities on the room but there was a TV (with UK Sky News) and a mini bar. No bar in the hotel but there are local yocal bars surrounding the hotel. Our room soon warmed up once we turned the heating on (Barcelona is freezing in November!!!!) All of the staff were great. Very pleasant and happy to talk to us non Spanish speaking Brits. They spoke excellent English and they were all very helpful. The buffet breakfast is fine. The Spanish sausage isn't that great but there was bacon and eggs and a nice selection of fruit, muffins, cakes and juices. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from the Gaudi's Sagrada Familia. Turn right out of the hotel... walk straight for about 15 minutes then turn right and you should be able to see it. There are quite a few cheap bars and cafes near by. Further to the left there is a shopping precinct consisting of mostly clothes shops and this and that. In summary, this is a great hotel for a stay of a few days in Barcelona. We would definitely go back here. For the price as well it was a bargain. Also, if you are flying with Ryanair from the UK to Girona, be prepared for a one hour bus journey to Barcelona. It isn't a big deal but be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and handy for Clot Metro Station to City”
Reviews.Author: scfcdave
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room and although the room was small it was perfectly adequate for us. We arrived at mid-day and were checked in promptly by a very pleasant receptionist who gave us a map of Barcelona and helped us with questions about transport and places to visit. The Clot Metro underground station is literally 2 minutes walk away and you are in the centre of Barcelona within 10 minutes and all the main attractions can be reached from here too. The hotel is ideally located as it is in a residential area although there is a busy main road at the end of the street. The hotel Albeniz is clean and the staff very pleasant, the breakfast is amazing for a small hotel and you can eat as much as you want. The rooms have a mini-bar fridge which is useful and satelite TV with Sky News and Canal+ which was great for watching Spanish football! We would definitely stay here again especially at the excellent price which worked out at £80 per night for the room and breakfast for 3 people and it is a good base from which to travel around the vibrant city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 Star base for a City visit”
Reviews.Author: WelshTaff
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews of this hotel was worried about what we would find, after booking a 4-night stay; however was on the whole pleasantly surprised. We arrived at the hotel at about 11.45 p.m. to be greeted by the night porter who as well as giving us our keys spent time giving city maps and explaining how to get to the main attractions. Rooms are adequately furnished, modern with TV, air conditioning and a toilet and bath/shower off. I suppose they could be described as small but were adequate for our city visit. We did find that the wall/floor were thin and noise carried with ease, especially if; as one night someone decided to hold a party at 3 a.m. in the morning! Breakfast in morning was as much as you could eat buffet with cereals, juice, rolls, eggs, bacon etc., As other reviews have pointed out the hotel bar is basically non existent, however we found many local bar within easy walking distance. Clot itself is a small suburb community with many local shops and a market running a small ‘promenade’. We actually found a shop selling Gaudi gift items for about a quarter the price of city centre ones. All in all we felt we the Hotel gave us an extremely good value for base for our Barcelona break.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel than a comfy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A_memberSouthWestUK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in March 07. Taxi from the airport cost about €20. A little disappointed upon our arrival. The reception and breakfast area are all in one room! There is no bar in this hotel. The breakfast was very disapppointing. On offer - peach juice, tea, coffee, cereals, cakes and pastries. Sounds ok when you write it down, but was all looking very sad and stale. They seemed to have run out of spoons most mornings. The room photos on the internet are very misleading. The room itself (a double) was the smallest, most cramped hotel room we have ever been in. When asked to upgrade to a bigger room, was told by the receptionist that the hotel was full, and the other rooms were of a similar size anyway. Wardrobe suitable for one persons belongings only. Nowhere to keep suitcase (if you kept it on the floor then that was all the available floor space taken!). The room had little natural daylight, as the shutter outside the window was broken, and couldn't be raised more than a quarter of the height of the window. Nothing to see outside anyway except a brick wall! We were at the back of the hotel, so our room was lovely and quiet to sleep in, with no noise from passing traffic etc. We had asked for a non smoking room, but the stale smell and ashtrays in the room suggested otherwise. The hotel info strongly advises that you use the room safe for valuables, but they do charge you to do this, and ask for a €50 deposit! The bathroom was shockingly small. So much so that you couldn't actually open the door to get in there, as the toilet was behind it. You could stand in the shower, clean your teeth over the sink, and flush the loo all at the same time! Was clean, but bathroom fittings a little dated. The hotel is within walking distance from the Segrada Familia. For all other sightseeing, Metro station Clot was just across the road from the hotel. It's easy to get a taxi from outside the hotel, we never waited more than a couple of minutes. This was our first time in Barcelona, so we asked the receptionist where to go for food on our first night. She recommended us to Port Olympico area. Very pretty as this was the marina, but sadly touts stand outside every single restaurant, and you cannot stroll without being accosted every 30 seconds. Not for us, so we left with empty stomachs and headed for the (less touristy!) Gothic Quarter, which had some great tapas restaurants. Despite several warnings about pickpockets, bag snatchers & muggings, we had no trouble at all from anyone, even on the Metro. Overall the rooms were suitable for single occupancy only, ok to use as a hostel to sleep in, but don't expect a sumptuous stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel comfortable if a little sterile. We were upgraded from the hotel next door. Did hear a little noise in the corridor but not enough to disturb sleep. Generally the room was good but we did get 2 singles instead of 1 double bed. Breakfast was good with lots of options available. Location was fine - short walk from the Sagrada Familia. Would consider this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return”
Reviews.Author: travellingaussies
Reviews.Content: While this was a clean, centrally located hotel I was disappointed with the experience. The staff were indifferent (three staff chatting at the breakfast bar, did not acknowledge guests at all). I must say that one of the reception staff was quite good, however, he was the only one of the four who was. The rooms have laminate flooring, which meant that when the people next door to us, above us and on the floor below returned at 2.00 am in the morning, we knew all about it! While not the fault of the hotel, some guests spent an hour running up and down the fire escape, yelling and slamming doors. After a guest complained, the 'gentleman' concerned was much quieter. I don't think I would stay here again. Please note that we stayed over a weekend, it may be much more pleasant during the week.

Reviews.Title: “A bad experience”
Reviews.Author: rfeijoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in the center of the city and the rooms are too small, but the worst thing was a parking problem that nearly ruin our trip. When we got to there, we could not find place in the parking of the hotel, and the receptionist told us to park the car outside in the street. So we did it. The next morning, when we left the hotel to go to the airport , we could not find our car. It has been towed away. Parking was not allowed there , the traffic sign was not visible enough. So we had to go as fast as possible to collect the car and pay a fine. We got late to the airport and we were about to miss our flight to Roma. In summary, the hotel is far away from the tourist center, the rooms are small, and the staff is not helpful. It is not a place I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: Burton61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel albeniz for three nights in Feb. 2004 with my husband. It is a lovely hotel. Spotlessly clean, the room was very comfortable. Room service was excellent, fresh towels daily. Breakfast choice very good.A little far from the centre but near the Metro station clot. While we were in barcelona we were victims of a scam. Some substance was thrown from above on to us and a very well dressed pleasant man helped us wipe ourselves and kindly pickpocketed my husband of his wallet!! Watch out if you are going to visit Barcelona. The Manger of the albeniz was very helpful to us and we were very impressed by the concern of the hotel. Well recommended. We also loved Barcelona and wouldn't be put off going again.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Albeniz
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Aragon 591-593, 08026 Barcelona, Spain
